Description:
Technical Responsibilites
  • Engineered a membership integration for the Royal Academy of Arts enabling bespoke customer data capture and post-purchase processing.
  • Performance optimization of v16 Ticket Limits extension as part of inter-group task force investigating TNEW latency for National Theatre, working closely with Senior leaders, product owners, and Innovation Group colleagues.
  • Engineered v16 Secure My Booking extension
  • Lead the team through Customization Framework v1.1, v1.2, and .NET 8 upgrades.
  • Member of the team that engineered v16 Direct Debit extension, focusing on feature implementation and defect resolution.
  • Member of the team that engineered v16 Education extension, focusing on feature implementation and defect resolution.
  • Engineered a proof-of-concept v16 extension integrating Angular with .NET MVC and the Customization Framework.
  • Ensuring all solutions are developed with appropriate unit test coverage and documentation.
  • Working closely with member organisations and internal stakeholders across the project lifecycle from initiation to delivery ensuring excellent communication and client satisfaction throughout, consistently meeting expectations.
  • Mentoring developers in the design, development, testing, deployment and maintenance of extensions and customizations.
Process Improvements
  • Collaborated with senior Technical, Product and Project Management colleagues in the design and implementation of a product release cadence ensuring the team is delivering value to our members through the regular release of new features and defect resolutions.
  • Collaborated with senior Product and Project Management colleagues in the design and implementation of Jira workflows, providing visibility of defect and release notes to our members.
  • Collaborated with Hosting Services colleagues to define new SQL release management processes (on-going)
  • Proactive authoring of processes and requirements as documentation deficiencies are recognized.
  • Authored recommended engineering standards for the Technical Solutions team (on-going).
  • In collaboration with Innovation Group colleagues, created Bamboo/Slack integration to improve visibility of AWS Lambda deployment notifications.
Name: Tessitura
Overview: <article class="col">Technical delivery and ownership of Tessitura Express Web (TNEW) extensions and customisations delivering value and impact to our member organisations, and meeting TN strategic requirements including:</article>

Roles.JobTitle: Lead Web Developer, Customizations and Extensions
Web Developer, API Consulting & Web Solutions

Description:
Technical Responsibilites
  • Technical ownership and delivery of an e-commerce website producing over £30m of revenue per annum.
  • Engineered a financial web app using React, Tessitura REST API, and MSSQL SSIS integration to facilitate regular reconciliation.
  • Engineered a Health & Safety incident reporting system that utilised Microsoft Forms, PowerAutomate Flows (serverless), a bespoke API (Azure AppServices), an Azure SQL database and a React/TypeScript SharePoint webpart.
  • Engineered SSRS reports using Tessitura, MSSQL and Visual Studio to meet stakeholder requirements.
  • Began development of a business logic layer for RSC SOAP to REST API conversion utilising Tessitura REST SDK, SOLID principles, Builder and Adaptor design patterns.
  • Improved Application Delivery department methodologies by implementing a DevOps model, utilising Continuous Integration/Deployment (CI/CD) and Test-Driven Development (TDD).
  • Reduced operational expenditure through effective management of cloud services, saving approx. £9000pa
Leadership and Management Responsibilities
  • Managed a £200,000 capital project, including procurement phases, to replace core infrastructure, including virtualisation hosts, storage (HPE StorMagic SAN), HPE Aruba switches, APC Power Supplies.
  • Managing, mentoring, and recruiting a talented team of developers, to deliver sustainable applications built on software best practices that meet the RSC's diverse and complex requirements.
  • Significant experience leading a team in a distributed office environment due to the Covid pandemic. A hybrid model has adopted following this.
  • Key point of contact for all applications and internal stakeholder management.
  • Guided key architectural decisions to ensure appropriate technical direction maximizing cost-efficiency.
  • Planned and managed IT budgets with the Head of IT Services.
  • Developed IT policies and processes which have improved organisational effectiveness and efficiency.
  • Influenced stakeholders at all levels on technical direction to align with organisational strategies.
  • Planned and managed team capacity to ensure sustainable project delivery schedules.
  • Supported the Director of Estates and IT in undertaking an application assessment across the RSC.
  • Built a nurturing, supportive environment and team culture allowing all developers to thrive.
  • Member of RSC Organisational Steering Group and CIOArts.
Name: Royal Shakespeare Company

Roles.Description:
• Engineered a 'What's On / Buy Tickets' solution, utilising Tessitura CRM API, that increased single-day revenue record from £250,000 to £865,000.
  • Designed a cloud application architecture that secured £560,000 of capital funding.
  • Engineered an innovative 'Select Your Own Seat' (SYOS) application using Tessitura CRM API and Scalable Vector Graphics. Engineered administration application to allow easier generation of SYOS facilities.
  • Led development of all software projects using C# and Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) and Service-Oriented Programming (SOP) across the software development lifecycle.
  • Led development of solutions integrating with business-critical applications, such as Tessitura CRM, HR/Payroll, and Finance systems, using C# and MSSQL (SSIS)
  • Developed and managed the RSC's main website, microsites, and the RSC's staff intranet.
  • Analysed and resolved application defects.
  • Planned projects in consultation with designers and stakeholders.
  • Ensured the PCI compliance of all web environments and applications.
  • Mentored junior developers

• Developed and managed the RSC's main website, microsites, and the RSC's staff intranet.
  • Managed websites including server/system and user administration.
  • Analysed and resolved application defects.
  • Planned projects in consultation with designers and stakeholders.
  • AWARD: British Computer Society (BCS) IT Department of the Year (2011)

Design and development, updating and maintaining the school's website and web-presence as the school's Webmaster. Providing technical support, guidance and training, throughout the school.</article>
